arts.ttl: Spurs' defeat by Bournemouth exposes a key flaw in Thomas Frank's squad as star called up by England comes crashing back down to earth, writes MATT BARLOW
arts.sum: MATT BARLOW: These are the days sent to test new Tottenham bosses. Never mind Manchester City away, it's the ones they're expected to win that cause anguish in this North London postcode.

arts.ttl: Opinion: Thomas Frank says Spurs won't make a certain signing after Bournemouth loss and it's a huge mistake
arts.sum: Could Thomas Frank be making a big transfer mistake! üëÄ

arts.ttl: Thomas Frank understands Tottenham fans booing after Bournemouth defeat
arts.sum: Spurs suffered their first Premier League loss of the season a week on from a 2-0 victory at Manchester City.

arts.ttl: Tottenham fans all make the same Solanke point after Richarlison‚Äôs ‚Äòshocker‚Äô vs Bournemouth
Tottenham 0-1 Bournemouth: Tremendous Cherries earn commanding victory over sluggish Spurs
arts.sum: Five minutes in, smart movement from Evanilson saw the striker bend his run within the box - entirely free of the clustered Tottenham defence - to get on the end of a pitch perfect pass from Marco Senesi. Heading into the first international break of the season, both sides now sit on six points after three matches, with Tottenham in third and Bournemouth in seventh.

arts.ttl: Evanilson‚Äôs early strike secures Bournemouth victory at Tottenham
arts.athr: Ed Aarons at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium
arts.sum: Three and easy for Thomas Frank? Well, not quite ‚Äì this is Tottenham after all. Instead it was Andoni Iraola‚Äôs outstanding Bournemouth side who ended his 100% start thanks to Evanilson‚Äôs early strike as familiar failings returned to haunt Spurs. Had things turned out differently this summer, Iraola could easily have found himself in the home dugout having been coveted by Tottenham before they eventually settled on Frank. But after Spurs won Frank‚Äôs first two matches since he succeeded Ange Postecoglou, their shortcomings were exposed by the Spaniard‚Äôs high press and only Bournemouth‚Äôs profligacy prevented their victory being even more convincing as the home players left the pitch to a smattering of boos. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Bournemouth bring Tottenham back down to earth as Evanilson secures win
arts.sum: Evanilson‚Äôs early goal settled the game in north London, but Bournemouth should have won by a greater margin.

arts.ttl: Brilliant Bournemouth beat shot-shy Spurs to inflict Frank's first PL loss
arts.sum: Thomas Frank suffered his first Premier League defeat as Spurs head coach after Bournemouth deservedly won 1-0 at the Tottenham Hotspur Stadium.

arts.ttl: Tottenham fans issue ¬£43m transfer plea to Daniel Levy after Brennan Johnson‚Äôs display vs Bournemouth

arts.ttl: Frank engine runs out of steam as Spurs deservedly beaten by Bournemouth
arts.sum: Thomas Frank suffers his first Premier League defeat as Tottenham Hotspur head coach on Saturday as Bournemouth deservedly overcome the Lilywhites 1-0 in North London.
